admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF023922-IBRD-FUNDED KOSOVO URGENT ROAD PROJECT,TF024762-DUTCH GRANT FOR KOSOVO - URGENT
            ROAD PROJECT,TF030319-FRENCH CTF FOR EXPERTISE FY03 - BALKANS,TF039841-YUGOSLAVIA - KOSOVO:EMERGENCY
            ROAD REHAB.

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The main lesson of this project is that the
            Bank can play a productive role in providing support in
            urgent operations dealing with post-conflict situations,
            provided there is a pragmatic approach to the issues at
            hand. The success of the Kosovo Urgent Road Project can be
            explained by: (i) the simplicity of the project, which
            focused on the indispensable capacity needed in the public
            and private sectors to keep the operability of the road
            network; and (ii) the willingness of the Bank to adapt the
            requirements of project preparation to the urgency of the
            project, accepting the trade-offs between short lead-times
            and limited data gathering and background studies. This was
            done with the knowledge that the recommended actions would
            not be substantially changed if there would have been time
            for extensive preparation. The project highlights the
            importance of the long term efforts necessary to achieve
            lasting improvements in institutional performance, the more
            so when those improvements are not limited to technical
            know-how but involve a profound revision of cultural mores.
